clues.text: In a T.S. Eliot play 4 knights murder Thomas Becket in this title sanctuary
In this ballet the Mouse King's wintry attack on the title character leads to rodent demise
In a Sondheim musical, the bodies really start to pile up when this title barber gets a new automated chair
In "Little Shop of Horrors", Seymour feeds this woman, his girlfriend, to the carnivorous plant named for her
Only the good die young, as when Mimi dies of consumption in this Puccini opera about young Parisians
In the mid-1950s this country trailed its neighbor in development, but the '60s "Miracle on the Han River" changed that
The Republican-led laws guiding seceded states' return to the Union are known as these acts of 1867 & 1868
This war ended England's major claims in France & would have lasted longer but in 1475, an invading army was bribed to go home
In 1992 the U.N. gave this country that had been occupied in the first Gulf War more land with more oil wells
The "Long Walls" of Athens were destroyed at this war's end to the accompaniment of flute music, but rebuilt in 393 B.C.
It sounds like a computer game about an island, but in weather lore it's very fine water droplets at ground level
This discharge can be spider, forked or sheet
I'm sick of the same weather again, the result of a stationary one of these where neither of the adjoining air masses can move
Big fluffy snowflakes result from relative humidity of over 100%, this condition of water in the atmosphere
Matey, batten down the hatches!  It be this 4-letter warning from the National Weather Service of sustained winds of 39-54 mph
In 2021 Jason Sudeikis let his daughter shave the mustache he wears as this title soccer coach
He wrote the first draft of his musical "In the Heights" when he was still in college

This 1-named rapper:
"Take this advice that I'm givin', make a difference, make a killin', make a killin', Lord willin"'
This woman hosts 2 different food-related shows: "Top Chef" & "Taste the Nation"

At the University of Chicago & other schools, the grading system consists of 5 letters, 3 that can have + added & these 2 that can't
These long, baggy men's knickers were popular on 1920s golf courses
Britain's eleven plus exams are basically entrance tests to admits kids to this kind of school that not our writers, obviously
At Bell Labs Bjarne Stroustrup designed this programming language released in 1985
In French the word plus means "more", as in this expression that begins, "plus ça change" (a translation is fine)
clues.response: the more things change the more they stay the same

clues.text: "Better safe than" this

A line from "The Godfather": "Leave the gun, take" this dessert
Marshmallows, almonds & chocolate ice cream pave the way to make this classic flavor
What the French call an omelette norvégienne is what Americans call this dessert

For 10 weeks in 1982, Britain & Argentina battled over this territory
With 2 territories on it, the U.K. joins Turkey & Greece as countries with influence on this Mediterranean island

In short, the Somers Islands is a former name of this British possession in the Atlantic

"Insanity runs in my family. It practically gallops", Cary Grant says in a 1944 comedy about his aunts' use of this
In 1960 Jane Goodall saw that the animal she'd dubbed David Greybeard, this type of primate, made & used tools
In 218 B.C. Hannibal left Spain with at least 37 of these animals; it's said the one-tusked Surus lasted the longest
The western lowland gorilla with this repetitive name, known for using sign language, died at age 46 in 2018
Many British govt. offices have cats called "Chief" this rodent-ridder; Palmerston worked in the foreign office 2016-2020
A German Shepherd named Trakr found the last survivor in the Manhattan area dubbed this after 9/ 11
The hardest tissue in your body, this tooth-topper predominately contains calcium & phosphate
Known for its hardness, durability & capacity to take a high polish, this heavy, black wood is big in cabinets & knife handles

Rubies & sapphires rate a 9 on this scale of hardness named for a German mineralogist
This white substance in the outer skeleton of crabs is used to bind dyes & as a strengthening agent for paper

rounds.category: AROUND THE TIME YOU WERE BORN

clues.text: Also called the Millennium Bug, this alphanumeric issue thankfully proved to be a non-problem on Jan. 1, 2000
It took 11 years & about $25 million, but in 2001 this landmark was reopened with its tilt reduced by about 16 inches
Released in 2003, this Pixar film about a dad trying to locate his son earned nearly $1 billion worldwide
On Dec. 13, 2003 U.S. forces near Tikrit found this president of Iraq underground; a gun was present, but he did not fire a shot
To collect solar wind particles, in 2001 NASA sent up this spacecraft that shares its name with a Bible book & a dad rock band

rounds.text: According to the famous poem, its name is "Mother of Exiles"
